jobDescription: The Research Data Analyst 3 will work as a member of the UC Davis VPRP. The Research Data Analyst 3 will be involved primarily in research or firearm violence, while also contributing to work violence research of other types, individual and social determinants of violence, risk prediction, and law enforcement and criminal justice activities.REQUIRED--Experience with scientific manuscript writing and data analysis in an academic or research setting. --Experience with performing and summarizing scientific literature reviews.--Advanced understanding of principals of epidemiological study design and execution and statistical data analysis. --Master's or Doctoral degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Public Health, or related field. --Experience with Microsoft Access, Excel, SharePoint, or related database management software. --Experience Programming, managing and analyzing data using R statistical software. PREFERRED--Knowledge of public health surveillance database. --Experience with GIS methods to examine spatiotemporal patterns of events under study.--Experience with hypothesis-driven data analysis, including lineal and logistic regression and non-paramedic regression.--Knowledge and application of project management principals and concepts.SPECIAL REQUIREMENT--THIS POSITION MAY BE SUBJECT TO A CRIMINAL BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION, DRUG SCREEN, LIVE SCAN FINGERPRINTING, MEDICAL EVALUATION CLEARANCE, AND FUNCTIONAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT
